intro: Lesquerella pulchella, commonly known as the showy lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its erect stem, alternate leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Lesquerella pulchella produces distinctive seed pods that split open to release seeds, a feature typical of many members of its family. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
